page.title: 13WORSBROUGH CANAL
page.content: {Worsbrough Canal}was opened in{1804 and closed early this century. {Worbrough Reservoir}was built to supply the canal with a constant supply of water.The canal was part of the{Dearne and Dove}system,most of the canal has now been filled in and has been restored to farmland.Boats used to go along the canal taking coal and other goods to places such as Manchester,Leeds and London.There is only a short stretch of water left now, about 60 metres long,but we can tell that there was once a flourishing canal trade in the area because of the names of some of the public houses along its course .There is the{Ship {Inn,Wharf}and the{Boatmans Rest}.In summer time people go fishing and swimming in what is left of the canal this is known locally as the{"Cut"} .
